Identity.History: The wild boar has a very large habitat, ranging from Europe to Asia to even Northern Africa. Large and sturdy, these close relatives of domesticated pigs can grow up to 6 feet (1.83 m) tall and can weigh over 100 pounds (45 kilograms). They primarily live off the leaves and roots of their forest habitat, but will, on occasion, eat anything from eggs to small mammals and even carrion. Wild boars can be extremely destructive. They use their broad snouts to forage, and they would be just as happy wandering through a vineyard or orchard as a forest.
